definition: to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: Some believe there are concerns among the central government as well.
sentences.chinese: 有些人認爲中央政府也存在這樣的憂慮。

sentences.english: Under such situations, many people feel worried.
sentences.chinese: 面對複雜的海疆形勢，許多國人感到憂慮。

sentences.english: An outbreak of cholera in Haiti continues to spread sickness and worry.
sentences.chinese: 海地霍亂爆發仍在繼續傳播疾病和憂慮。

sentences.english: Worrying is like a rocking chair, it gives you something to do, but it gets you nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 憂慮就像坐在搖椅上，只會原地搖，哪裏也到不了。
別往心裏去，別爲此而憂慮傷神。

sentences.english: Sea and Ikeda chat, tells his worries.
sentences.chinese: 海和池田聊天，告訴了他自己的憂慮。

sentences.english: The Leaders expressed deep concern over the destabilising effect of regional conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 雙方領導人對地區衝突帶來的不穩定影響深表憂慮。

sentences.english: The red-shirts are far from Mr Abhisit’s only worry.
sentences.chinese: 對阿披實而言，紅衫軍已遠非他的唯一憂慮。

sentences.english: How can I cast away all my cares and worries ?
sentences.chinese: 如何才能將所有的擔心憂慮置之腦後呢？

sentences.english: In order to assuage these worries, the meeting must produce tangible achievements.
sentences.chinese: 爲了緩和這些憂慮，會晤必須產生切實的成就。

sentences.english: His face peers anxiously into mine.
sentences.chinese: 他一臉憂慮地凝視着我的臉。

sentences.english: But many Western concerns are absurd.
sentences.chinese: 但西方的很多憂慮是荒謬的。

sentences.english: Upon hearing the worries of the planet, the king of the moon came.
sentences.chinese: 月之王聽到了蓋雅的憂慮而來。

sentences.english: His anxieties threatened to unbalance his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的憂慮可能使他陷於精神錯亂。

sentences.english: After lunch Aunt Huang came in and she looked worried.
sentences.chinese: 午飯後，黃阿姨進來了而看起來憂慮。

sentences.english: Rational fear is good - it stops us getting killed.
sentences.chinese: 合理的憂慮是好的，它讓我們不至於滅亡。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
